revised_title: Exploring Reciprocal Innervation and Antagonistic Muscles in the Nervous System
tldr: Sherrington and Hering's study investigates the phenomenon of reciprocal innervation, where the relaxation of one set of muscles occurs alongside the contraction of another set due to excitation of the cortex cerebri. They demonstrate this through experiments on monkeys and cats, providing insight into the complex interactions within the nervous system.
